# baselineAdjustment

**Instance Property**

An option that controls whether the text’s baseline remains fixed when text needs to shrink to fit in the label.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var baselineAdjustment: UIBaselineAdjustment { get set }
```

## Discussion

If [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/adjustsFontSizeToFitWidth] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], this property controls the behavior of the text baselines in situations where the text needs the font size adjusted in order to fit. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBaselineAdjustment/alignBaselines]. This property is effective only when the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/numberOfLines] is `1`.

## Sizing the label’s text

- **adjustsFontSizeToFitWidth**: A Boolean value that determines whether the label reduces the text’s font size to fit the title string into the label’s bounding rectangle.
- **allowsDefaultTighteningForTruncation**: A Boolean value that determines whether the label tightens text before truncating.
- **minimumScaleFactor**: The minimum scale factor for the label’s text.
- **numberOfLines**: The maximum number of lines for rendering text.
- **sizingRule**: The typographic bounds-sizing behavior that handles text with fonts that contain oversize characters.
